hits.name: Healthtech 1
hits.long_description:
Healthtech 1 digitises repetitive processes for healthcare organisations. The first product launched 18 months ago for 'New Patient Registrations' is now live in 100+ NHS Primary Care practices across England.

Based out of Raj's parents' Primary Care practice the Healthtech 1 team are systematically digitising the repetitive processes they experience everyday, saving thousands of hours of staff time. 

Why now? 
The UK's National Health Service (NHS) delivers free healthcare in 590 million patient contacts every year. Post-pandemic, Britain's most treasured institution is in crisis. Patient satisfaction is at 25 year low and 1/7 staff are applying for Non-NHS jobs fuelling an 11% recruitment gap. 

By digitising the 100s of repetitive processes in the NHS, Healthtech 1 will reverse the trend, and produce the world's most productive health caresystem.
hits.one_liner: Digitising repetitive processes in healthcare

hits.name: truemetrics
hits.long_description:
Maps are incomplete. They miss information about parking spots or entrances. But all this information is crucial to ensure smooth deliveries. Our technology is currently used by GLS to guide their couriers right to the doorstep of every customer, thereby ensuring that ~600M deliveries per year are smoothly delivered. 

We capture data about parking positions, entrance locations and segment times by analyzing sensor data that comes from the drivers’ smartphones. This data allows our customers to optimize delivery processes and improve overall efficiency.

hits.name: AutoInfra
hits.long_description:
Automating Devops and Infra Teams. 

AutoInfra is an LLM powered chat product to control AWS infrastructure. In addition, we enhance on-call engineers by having AI suggested resolutions ready to deploy when an outage happens.

I'm building the shift from Infrastructure-as-Code -> Infrastructure-as-Language 

We want to automate most of what DevOps and Infra teams do. First, this looks like a Slack interface to message things you want to do with your Infra, second we act like an always online on call engineer, using LLMs to constantly monitor logs and alert/message when somethings wrong. If the issue is Infra related, we'll have a fix ready to deploy too (pending human approval)


What we have now:
- A Slack interface to control all of your AWS account with natural language. Create, modify, link services all just by asking
- AI Log Analysis and resolution for all your AWS services. Get a report on everything you have at whatever cadence you prefer. For example, if your logs show errors due to lack of disk space, we'll have a fix ready for immediate approval in Slack
hits.one_liner: Infrastructure as Language. Automating DevOps and Infra with AI.
hits.subindustry: B2B Software and Services -> Engineering, Product and Design

hits.name: AiSDR
hits.long_description:
AiSDR is building an AI-powered sales automation platform to allow companies automatically:
- qualify inbound leads;
- create and send-out personalized email campaigns and;
- correspond with their prospects with a goal to book a sales meeting.

Basically replacing a sales development representative (SDR) - the most entry level sales position.

Companies spend $80,000 per SDR per year (fully loaded cost). With over 600,000 SDRs in the US - they are spending $48 billion on this. We can help them reduce those costs by 90%, while growing the sales pipeline.

We are second-time YC-backed founders. We sold our first company (AXDRAFT) in 2020. We started AiSDR, because after being in sales for over 5 years as a founder I became really excited by a possibility to use generative AI to fully automate the most painful part of the sales process - prospecting.

If you have any questions about sales or prospecting, I'll be happy to help. You can reach me at yz@aisdr.com.

hits.name: Converge
hits.all_locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; London, England, United Kingdom
hits.long_description:
Tracking customer events (e.g. Add To Cart, Purchase, etc.) correctly is important, yet unattainable for most online stores due to the limitations of tracking in the browser and lack of in-house developers.

Converge auto-tracks all important events – across the browser, store backend and subscription platforms. Once tracking is set up, Converge allows online stores to forward these events with the flip of a switch to their advertising platforms and analytics tools leading to improved ad performance and better insights.

Our larger vision is to go beyond data infrastructure; and do for the CDP what Salesforce has done for the CRM. Our customers often use a bunch of tools to understand and interact with their customers and we are in an excellent position to consolidate this set of capabilities on top of one single customer data layer.
hits.one_liner: Segment for Ecommerce

hits.name: refine
hits.all_locations: Remote; San Francisco, CA, USA; Istanbul, Istanbul, Turkey
hits.long_description:
refine is an open-source, headless React framework for rapidly building enterprise web applications. It eliminates many repetitive tasks like

➡️ CRUD operations
➡️ State management
➡️ Routing
➡️ Authentication
➡️ Access Control
➡️ i18n

and saves days of development time.

So far, thousands of great projects have been built by 15,000+ monthly active refine developers. Use cases are ranging from admin panels, dashboards, and internal tools to B2B solutions and complex SaaS interfaces. 

refine is backed by a strong community featuring 12K GitHub stars ⭐️, 150+ contributors and 2,500 Discord members. 

Thanks to it's unique "Headless UI" approach, refine works with any custom design. It has also ready-made integrations with 4 most popular UI frameworks: Ant Design, Material UI, Chakra UI and Mantine. refine is totally backend agnostic and it can connect to 15+ backend services out-of-the-box, incl. custom REST & GraphQL API's.

With refine, developers always have 100% control over their projects as they build, style and deploy the way they like.
hits.one_liner: Open-source platform for building enterprise web applications

hits.name: Cerelyze
hits.long_description:
Cerelyze makes it easy for engineers to implement cutting edge research in their products. We do this by automatically converting methods in the paper into executable python code

The world of tech research is currently facing a problem of too much information. It takes an arduous amount of time to iterate over possible state of the art research papers, because well.. every paper claims to be state of the art these days. 

You have to implement it in your own use case to see if it actually works for you. This is a slow process. We plan to make this process drastically faster by fundamentally changing the way engineers consume & reproduce technical articles to build software. Our early users are already exploring use cases in fields such as machine learning, embedded systems programming, biotech and quantitative finance.

We believe that in the next 5 years, much of technological innovation would not be in the form of writing code inside a terminal, but instead having conversations with powerful computer programs (much like Jarvis from Iron Man 🦾 🚀). We are very excited about it and want to be the builders of this future.
hits.one_liner: Tool for engineers to implement research papers 100x faster

That's why we proudly embrace open source, with over 23K ⭐️ on GitHub, 22K members on our Discord community, and a thriving contributor base. With backing from prominent VCs like Y Combinator in our pre-seed funding round, we're poised to transform the AI industry.

hits.name: PeerDB
hits.long_description:
PeerDB is a Postgres-compatible SQL interface to seamlessly integrate multiple data-stores. It enables you to sync, transform and query data across your stores using simple SQL commands. PeerDB takes a datastore native approach in engineering — enabling 10x faster and a highly reliable ETL experience for you.

We are starting with Postgres, Snowflake and BigQuery as the supported data-stores and plan to expand to others based on user-feedback.

You can use PeerDB for any of the below use-cases:

1. Real-time sync (CDC) across stores.
2. Customized ETL across data-stores using SQL
3. Federated query workloads - Query multiple data-stores through a common SQL interface
hits.one_liner: Modern ETL in minutes, with SQL

hits.name: HyLight
hits.long_description:
We build small unmanned hydrogen airships to automatically gather massive amounts of precise data in a sustainable and cost-effective way.

We currently focus on:
- Power line inspection to prevent outages, reduce wildfire risks ($19 billion per year in the US), and ensure grid reliability.
- Pipeline inspection to detect methane leaks (4% of global greenhouse gas emissions).

We have already built four prototypes, two minimum viable products (MVPs), and are running a paid pilot with the largest power line company in Europe.
hits.one_liner: Small unmanned hydrogen airships for long range monitoring

hits.name: HockeyStack
hits.long_description:
HockeyStack is an analytics tool that collects & connects all data about a B2B SaaS company's customer journey from various sources, and allows everyone to easily visualize the data. 

This allows companies to:
- Know exactly what sources & segments drive revenue most efficiently
- Find common pathways to conversion
- Understand indicators of intent and find high-intent leads
- and fulfill any other data-related need

Tracking setup takes just a couple minutes. Creating reports takes a couple more. And as soon as you're done, you get 100% visibility into all of your marketing, sales, product engagement, customer success, and revops.
hits.one_liner: Connect & visualize B2B customer data with no code
